intro: Aechmea ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty pineapple, is a striking bromeliad native to South America. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped foliage that forms a central cup to collect rainwater. The leaves are broad, leathery, and often have a reddish or rusty hue, giving the plant its common name. It produces vibrant orange or red flowers that bloom from the center of the rosette. This plant is popular in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in indoor environments.
